question: On treating 100 mL of 0.1 M aqueous solution of the complex CrCl₃.6H₂O with excess of AgNO₃, 2.86 g of AgCl was obtained. The complex is:
explanation: Moles of complex = Molarity * Volume = 0.1 * 0.1 = 0.01 mol.
Moles of AgCl = Mass / Molar Mass = 2.86 g / 143.5 g/mol ≈ 0.02 mol.
This means 2 Chloride ions are ionizable (outside the coordination sphere).
